keyMoments.title: Baroque Works Organization Structure Revealed
keyMoments.description: The episode reveals the hierarchical structure of Baroque Works, including Frontier Agents, Officer Agents, the codename system, and the mystery of the leader known only as Mr. 0.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Baroque Works as a major antagonistic force with a complex organization, setting up the conflict for the Arabasta Saga.

keyMoments.title: Arabasta Conspiracy Revealed
keyMoments.description: Vivi explains that Baroque Works has been orchestrating a civil war in Arabasta as part of their plan to overthrow the kingdom.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the organization's ultimate goal and the scope of their operations, making them a kingdom-level threat.

enemies.reason: Straw Hats discovered their conspiracy and agreed to help Princess Vivi
Baroque Works is planning to overthrow the Arabasta Kingdom

reveals.information: Baroque Works has a hierarchical system with Frontier Agents (numbered pairs like Mr. 8 and Miss Monday) and Officer Agents (numbered pairs like Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine), with members not knowing the boss's true identity
The organization's ultimate goal is to overthrow the Kingdom of Arabasta by orchestrating a civil war
The organization is led by a mysterious figure known only by the codename Mr. 0

keyMoments.title: Internal Conflict: Luffy vs Zoro
keyMoments.description: The crew experiences internal conflict when Luffy and Zoro fight each other due to a misunderstanding about the bounty hunters.
keyMoments.significance: One of the rare instances of serious internal crew conflict, demonstrating that even the strongest bonds can be tested by miscommunication.

keyMoments.title: Agreement to Protect Vivi
keyMoments.description: Zoro agrees to protect Princess Vivi on behalf of the crew, setting the stage for their involvement in the Arabasta conflict.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the beginning of the Straw Hats' involvement in saving the Arabasta Kingdom.
